article.headline: Valparaiso 103, Oakland, Mich. 102
article.story: ROCHESTER, Mich. -- Brandon Wood scored 35 points and Cory Johnson added 33 as Valparaiso edged Oakland 103-102 to win the Lou Henson Award Holiday Tournament on Tuesday night. Michael Rogers added 10 points for the Crusaders (9-4), who overcame a double-digit deficit in the second half and held off a late charge by the Golden Grizzlies (7-7). After Valparaiso took a 103-96 lead with 18 seconds to play, Larry Wright hit consecutive 3s -- the second coming with 4 seconds remaining -- to make it a one-point game. Erik Buggs then missed two free throws for Valparaiso, but Ryan Broekhoff came up with the offensive rebound to seal the win. Reggie Hamilton led the Grizzlies with 26 points, and Wright finished with 24. Oakland led 52-45 at halftime and pushed its advantage to 10 early in the second half before Valparaiso rallied.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
